Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk ibus
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: ibus bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The Intelligent Input Bus (IBus) is an input method framework for multilingual input in Unix-like operating systems. This update fixes the following bugs: Due to a race condition, the X11 application became unresponsive when the user switched input contexts between the parent and the child windows while typing using IBus. The race condition has been resolved, IBus now properly handles the situation, and the application no longer hangs. (BZ#1183909) Previously, the update-gtk-immodules script searched for a no longer existing /etc/gtk-2.0/$host directory. Consequently, the post script of the ibus-gtk2 package failed and exited without creating or updating the cache. The post script has been changed to replace update-gtk-immodules with gtk-query-immodules-2.0-BITS, thus fixing this bug. (BZ#1191825) Users of IBus are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
